summary: The Final Crown of Winter Roses
title: The Final Crown of Winter Roses
description:
by wxntxr_chxld

“We are spokes on a wheel, this ones on top, then that ones on top and on and on it spins crushing those on the ground.”

“It’s a beautiful dream, stopping the wheel. You’re not the first person who’s ever dreamt it”

“I’m not going to stop the wheel, i’m going to break the wheel”

summary: In my mind I imagine this being at the end of the great war, all of Jon and Dany friends and allies that they have known and...
body:
I love this ♥️.♥️

In my mind I imagine this being at the end of the great war, all of Jon and Dany friends and allies that they have known and admired dead….they go back to the dragon pit where it all started for their family.

Because was the last historic ‘building’ that stood throughout it all.

And just walk around and look back at what they have lost, achieved and gained ♥️👑

blog.name: winterfellchild
blog.title: The pack survives
blog.description:
"She (Daenerys) has the power to destroy, she can wipe out entire cities, and we
certainly see that in ‘Fire and Blood.’ We see the dragons wiping out 
entire armies, wiping out towns and cities, destroying them, but that 
doesn’t necessarily enable you to rule — it just enables you to destroy." GRRM

tags: not really anti-Dænerys imo but I know her fans don't like to think that Jon3rys romance wasn't so romantic and perfect
so I'm tagging it anti-Dænerys to avoid cross tagging
I know some people can get so mad about this but this is the original line from the episode
I agree with Peterson that it doesn't seem really important at first
because if you take it out of context it doesn't say much
what happened from the beginningof the episode
this is exactly why the other part of the fandom dismiss the fact that Jon was her prisoner
because he was free to wander the island
so thanks Peterson for confirming that he wasn't so free
at least he was guarded by a Dothraki
summary: Linguist David J. Peterson ( language creator of the Dothraki and Valyrian languages for GoT) about the unsubtitled line Dænerys...
caption:
Linguist David J. Peterson ( language creator of the Dothraki and Valyrian languages for GoT) about the unsubtitled line Dænerys said in Dothraki when she ordered her guard to escort Jon and Davos to their chambers in episode 7x03 (x).

As one of the people who always said that Jon was her prisoner in Dragonstone, I think Peterson surprise about this is pretty interesting especially his final line “I don’t know. By not subtitling it I think it made it seem more important than it was…?” because it made me think that there was a specific reason why they decided not to use the subtitles for that line… after all this is GoT, the show that is supposed to pay a lot of attention even to small things like this one.

And it is even more noteworthy when I consider that this is what followed:

JON:  Am I your prisoner?
DÆNERYS:  Not yet.

So, with the added subtitles, this is how I see this scene 

Dænerys: Keep an eye on them ( said in another language so Jon and Davos won’t understand her)
Jon: Am I your prisoner?
Dænerys:  Not yet.

Just my opinion but that “not yet” sounds even more false this way and I think this is the reason why they didn’t use subtitles.


Let’s also consider that even before their meeting the Dothraki, operating under Dænerys orders, already took Jon’s boat and weapons so it was already clear that he wasn’t free to go home.

But if they added that he was not even free to wander the island that would have made Jon’s prisoner status unquestionable.

Instead, they eliminated the subtitles and therefore there are people in this fandom that firmly believe that Jon wasn’t a prisoner… because you know, he wasn’t behind bars and was FREE to wander the island.

Well, as far as I’m concerned, even if he was on a beautiful island Jon wasn’t so free and for me:

a golden cage is still just a cage.

tags: if you want to genderswap with any success it'd have to be modern au sorry
summary: What if Daenerys and Jon were genderswapped? Female Jon's storyline might be harder because she can't join the Night's Watch. Is...
question: What if Daenerys and Jon were genderswapped? Female Jon's storyline might be harder because she can't join the Night's Watch. Is it possible that Viserys sells male Dany to, say, buy an army, so male Dany becomes a slave himself and knows what it's like to be sold. Idk but it seems like an interesting contrast if Viserys and Dany were both boys, but they both turned out completely different.
answer:
You can see my posts on genderswapped Jon under this tag.

For genderswapped Dany, I really have no idea what his life would have been like after a certain point. The birth and the escape from Dragonstone to Braavos would be the same. (Though not certain of the name - maybe “Daeron” in memory of the good king who united Westeros? but Rhaella already had a son named Daeron who died, and there are no male “Daen” Targ names we know of. I guess I’ll stick with Danny, ugh.) After Willem Darry died, Viserys certainly would have taken care of a little brother if charged to do so, but without the thought they’d marry one day, of course, so perhaps there’d be more resentment and less brief flashes of love. (Though one factor of Viserys’s verbal abuse – that Dany was born too late to marry Rhaegar – would no longer apply.) But I could also see Viserys always saying that when he becomes king, Danny would be his Hand, like Aegon III and Viserys II, his most loyal and loving subject.

But once the Targaryen boys get to Illyrio… I don’t even know. No, Viserys wouldn’t sell his brother – to who? Nobody wants a Targaryen male slave that much. Dany’s value was that she was a young beautiful virgin of rare birth and appearance that a powerful khal could marry to appear better and more powerful than all the other khals. So the Dothraki are not an option. A pretty young boy might have some value in Lys, for the pedo slavers, but they specialize in breeding slaves with the silver-gold hair and purple eyes of Valyria, Danny wouldn’t be that exceptional, certainly not valuable enough to buy an army. And Viserys, no matter how beaten down and mad, wouldn’t ever be so callous as to sell a brother into sex slavery. (You say “but he sold his sister!” ah, but brides are expected to be sold and to please their husbands, because misogyny and patriarchy, and Dany wasn’t technically a slave, she was a khaleesi, married in full ceremony to a “barbarian” king. Selling a brother to pedophile slavers is a completely different matter.)

So all I can think is that if Illyrio wants to use some kind of marriage scheme for Viserys to get an army, it would have to be marrying Viserys to a Triarch’s daughter, or something like that, some Free Cities person with clout. Danny’s too young and not high enough status to be a valuable groom, he’d just be there for the ride. No Dothraki involved. No Jorah attracted to the princess who looks like his ex-wife. No dragon eggs as a bride gift. And pfft… the plot’s off track entirely. Whether Viserys succeeds or no, gets killed or no, serves as Aegon’s mummer’s dragon or no, Danny’s story is absolutely nothing like Dany’s.

So, yeah, in Essos society Dany’s story of a bride sold to a Dothraki khal is a uniquely female gendered story, just like Jon’s Westeros society journey to and through the Night’s Watch is a uniquely male gendered story. You can’t genderswap them and keep the plot intact in any way, sorry!

reblog.comment:
You can see my posts on genderswapped Jon under this tag.

For genderswapped Dany, I really have no idea what his life would have been like after a certain point. The birth and the escape from Dragonstone to Braavos would be the same. (Though one factor of Viserys’s verbal abuse – that Dany was born too late to marry Rhaegar – would no longer apply.) But I could also see Viserys always saying that when he becomes king, Danny would be his Hand, like Aegon III and Viserys II, his most loyal and loving subject.

But once the Targaryen boys get to Illyrio… I don’t even know. No, Viserys wouldn’t sell his brother – to who? Nobody wants a Targaryen male slave that much. Dany’s value was that she was a young beautiful virgin of rare birth and appearance that a powerful khal could marry to appear better and more powerful than all the other khals. So the Dothraki are not an option. A pretty young boy might have some value in Lys, for the pedo slavers, but they specialize in breeding slaves with the silver-gold hair and purple eyes of Valyria, Danny wouldn’t be that exceptional, certainly not valuable enough to buy an army. And Viserys, no matter how beaten down and mad, wouldn’t ever be so callous as to sell a brother into sex slavery. (You say “but he sold his sister!” ah, but brides are expected to be sold and to please their husbands, because misogyny and patriarchy, and Dany wasn’t technically a slave, she was a khaleesi, married in full ceremony to a “barbarian” king. Selling a brother to pedophile slavers is a completely different matter.)

So all I can think is that if Illyrio wants to use some kind of marriage scheme for Viserys to get an army, it would have to be marrying Viserys to a Triarch’s daughter, or something like that, some Free Cities person with clout. Danny’s too young and not high enough status to be a valuable groom, he’d just be there for the ride. No Dothraki involved. No Jorah attracted to the princess who looks like his ex-wife. No dragon eggs as a bride gift. And pfft… the plot’s off track entirely. Whether Viserys succeeds or no, gets killed or no, serves as Aegon’s mummer’s dragon or no, Danny’s story is absolutely nothing like Dany’s.

So, yeah, in Essos society Dany’s story of a bride sold to a Dothraki khal is a uniquely female gendered story, just like Jon’s Westeros society journey to and through the Night’s Watch is a uniquely male gendered story. You can’t genderswap them and keep the plot intact in any way, sorry!

trail.content_raw:
You can see my posts on genderswapped Jon under this tag.

For genderswapped Dany, I really have no idea what his life would have been like after a certain point. The birth and the escape from Dragonstone to Braavos would be the same. (Though not certain of the name - maybe “Daeron” in memory of the good king who united Westeros? but Rhaella already had a son named Daeron who died, and there are no male “Daen” Targ names we know of. I guess I’ll stick with Danny, ugh.) After Willem Darry died, Viserys certainly would have taken care of a little brother if charged to do so, but without the thought they’d marry one day, of course, so perhaps there’d be more resentment and less brief flashes of love. (Though one factor of Viserys’s verbal abuse – that Dany was born too late to marry Rhaegar – would no longer apply.) But I could also see Viserys always saying that when he becomes king, Danny would be his Hand, like Aegon III and Viserys II, his most loyal and loving subject.

But once the Targaryen boys get to Illyrio… I don’t even know. No, Viserys wouldn’t sell his brother – to who? Nobody wants a Targaryen male slave that much. Dany’s value was that she was a young beautiful virgin of rare birth and appearance that a powerful khal could marry to appear better and more powerful than all the other khals. So the Dothraki are not an option. A pretty young boy might have some value in Lys, for the pedo slavers, but they specialize in breeding slaves with the silver-gold hair and purple eyes of Valyria, Danny wouldn’t be that exceptional, certainly not valuable enough to buy an army. And Viserys, no matter how beaten down and mad, wouldn’t ever be so callous as to sell a brother into sex slavery. (You say “but he sold his sister!” ah, but brides are expected to be sold and to please their husbands, because misogyny and patriarchy, and Dany wasn’t technically a slave, she was a khaleesi, married in full ceremony to a “barbarian” king. Selling a brother to pedophile slavers is a completely different matter.)

So all I can think is that if Illyrio wants to use some kind of marriage scheme for Viserys to get an army, it would have to be marrying Viserys to a Triarch’s daughter, or something like that, some Free Cities person with clout. Danny’s too young and not high enough status to be a valuable groom, he’d just be there for the ride. No Dothraki involved. No Jorah attracted to the princess who looks like his ex-wife. No dragon eggs as a bride gift. And pfft… the plot’s off track entirely. Whether Viserys succeeds or no, gets killed or no, serves as Aegon’s mummer’s dragon or no, Danny’s story is absolutely nothing like Dany’s.

So, yeah, in Essos society Dany’s story of a bride sold to a Dothraki khal is a uniquely female gendered story, just like Jon’s Westeros society journey to and through the Night’s Watch is a uniquely male gendered story. You can’t genderswap them and keep the plot intact in any way, sorry!

blog.name: reddragon1995
blog.title: Jonerys Snowstorm Of House Stargaryen
blog.description: HE LOVED HER AND SHE LOVED HIM

summary: When did Jon and Dany realize they were in love?
body:
When did Jon and Dany realize they were in love?

Jon:

When she flies her dragons beyond the wall to save his ass from another stupid fucking plan. I can’t find the exact gif but she lands on Drogon, starts spraying fire on those wights, and Jon is in awe of his warrior Queen. And he’s ready to rip out NK’s throat when he kills Viserion. He loved Dany before that, but realized it then.

Dany:

No matter what bullshit she said to Tyrion later, she knew it here. She doesn’t want him to go because she knows it’s a stupid fucking idea and he could get himself killed. She doesn’t protest Jorah going, but bae has to stay with her.

blog.name: kit-tastik
blog.title: Kit/Jon/GoT obsessed
blog.description:
"If you don't have anything nice to say don't say anything at all."
Header and fantastic art by Leffies art.
check it here on Tumblr or Patreon

summary: About Stark family and the Lords of the North
body:
About Stark family and the Lords of the North

So, it occurred to me (and I sincerely hope that D&D thought the same) that whoever went against house Stark didn’t fare well in the long run.

House Frey sure had thrown a hard blow to house Stark killing Robb, but as Arya reminded him ‘leave one wolf alive and the sheep are never safe’. And so, voila, house Frey saw its extinction.

House Bolton?? Pff, they tried, I mean Roose tried to have the upper hand on the Starks, and then Ramsay just helped extinguishing his House by killing first his father and then his wife and newborn son. And then he died. Gruesomely. In a bloody battle. Punched to almost death by the bastard of Winterfell and sentenced to death by none other than Sansa Stark, the wife he on which he had lain hands upon.

So now who’s the House who always pays it’s debts?? Shouldn’t we find another motto for the Starks?? Like.. anyone who tried to end and harm them directly or indirectly found death in one way or another..(Littlefinger!)

And honestly, if I was in the shoes of any of the lords of the North I would remember what happened and I would think better before going against that house and rebelling against their chosen King (I am talking about his decision to bend the knee but also the fact that he is actually bringing dragons north etc etc)

So in my opinion the lords would likely make a lot of noise but no harm would come from that at the end. They’ll not want their house end. So even if there is someone not so loyal or angry for the choices Jon made, they most likely would want to hear his reasons before causing someone’s ire.

By the way I never understood what they were expecting when he departed for Dragonstone. He was searching for armies, and for Dany ti help him? So it was obvious that he would have brought her armies north if succeeding!!

And as far as it concerns bending the knee??? I mean we know that at the end it wasn’t necessary, but in a normal situation any monarch would have asked something like that before moving an entire army throughout half the continent to help in whatever war they are facing!! It’s not like moving two little wooden dragons is moving an entire army!!

Anyway, I expect every genre of gossip around that and if they don’t give me at least a scene with that in s8 I scream
